measurement: Is a user session active on the simulation endpoint?
description: Indicates whether or not the user session on the logon simulation endpoint is active.
interpretation: This measure shows if there is an active user session on the logon simulation endpoint. The value "Yes" (numeric 1) means a session is currently active, while "No" (numeric 0) means there is no active session. Dashboards typically plot the numeric values 0 and 1 to visualize when the session status changes over time.
troubleshootingSteps: If the value remains "No" when a session is expected to be active, verify that the logon simulation is configured and scheduled correctly.
Check the health and connectivity of the simulation endpoint and any synthetic/agent process responsible for maintaining the session.
Confirm that authentication steps (credentials, MFA, redirects) are succeeding so that a session can be established and kept alive.
Correlate session status changes with application outages, login errors, or maintenance windows to understand why sessions may be dropping.
